title: AI in 2025: From Hype to Habit
description: Dr. Vishal Sharma vishal.sharma@fulbrightmail.org Not long ago, the word “Artificial Intelligence (AI)” would bring to mind images of sci-fi robots, self-aware machines, or futuristic cities powered by sentient computers. Fast forward to 2025, AI doesn’t just live in science labs or high-tech companies, it is woven into the everyday lives of billions of people often without them realizing it. From the moment we wake-up until we retire to bed, we encounter various AI tools that cater to our day-to-day requirements. […]
content:

title: Shashi Tharoor Meets AI Teen Prodigy On Vande Bharat Train, Calls The Interaction "Illuminating"
description: Tharoor described the interaction as "illuminating" and praised the teenager's work in making artificial intelligence more inclusive.
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor shared a viral encounter from a Vande Bharat Express journey where he met Raul John Aju, a 16-year-old AI innovator from Kochi. Tharoor described the interaction as "illuminating" and praised the teenager's work in making a... [2351 chars]

title: Germany's Mittelstand cuts AI investments in 2025, study shows
description: Germany's small and medium-sized companies, collectively known as the Mittelstand, are putting the brakes on artificial intelligence investment, a study showed, even as overall corporate spending on AI applications rises.
content:
BERLIN, Jan 8 (Reuters) - Germany's small and medium-sized companies, collectively known as the Mittelstand, are putting the brakes on artificial intelligence investment, a study showed, even as overall corporate spending on AI applications rises.

title: One of the world's biggest PC company Dell admits: Buyers don't care about AI PCs, as it only…
description: Tech News News: Dell made a startling confession at CES 2026 this week: consumers simply aren't interested in buying PCs because of artificial intelligence features. .
content: Dell admits at CES 2026 that consumers aren't buying PCs for AI features, finding them confusing rather than helpful. The company learned that traditional qualities like battery life and performance are prioritized over experimental AI. This honesty ... [2355 chars]

title: Exclusive: Nvidia requires full upfront payment for H200 chips in China, sources say
description: Nvidia is requiring full upfront payment from Chinese customers seeking its H200 artificial intelligence chips, hedging it against ongoing uncertainty over Beijing's approval of the shipments, said two people briefed on the matter.
content:
The U.S. chipmaker has imposed unusually stringent terms requiring full payment for orders with no options to cancel, ask for refunds or change configurations after placement, the people said.
